Texte.moveMess: To move - click on a yellow sqare!
Texte.stepsTxt: Here are the steps to follow in order to start a game :
Texte.bananaTxt: The banana allows you to play a wicked trick on another player! When you throw it to an opponent, you make this opponent momentarily less good. Indeed, for the next 90 secondes after a banana toss, the questions asked to your opponent will be more difficult and (s)he will loose 2 yellow squares!
Texte.bookTxt: The book eliminates an answer choice for you on a multiple choice question.
Texte.crystalTxt: If you feel unable to answer a question, you may use the crystal ball. The computer will then give you a new and easier question.
Texte.shopTxt: It is here that you can spend your coins!
Texte.coinTxt: The coins you pick up on your way allow you to buy objects.
Texte.teacherFrame1: Teachers Section Charging the list of rooms...
Texte.reportTextChange: Select a room to see a report...
Texte.errorPWD: Wrong password! Try again or choose another room!
Texte.textGUI_PWD: You need a password to enter this room...
Texte.nomAlert: Give a name to the room!
Texte.passAlert: Password protecting your room ensure that only your pupils can the access it. Accordingly the report will contain only their game results.
Texte.restartText: You are already assigned to a running game. Do you want to rejoin it or start a new game?
Texte.bugReportMess: The error was successfully reported. Thanks!
Texte.pointsMessage: Bonus Points to reach the finish line
Texte.descriptionPrincipale: It's the heart of Math en Jeu. There is a huge questions library for each of the specific mathematic domains.
Texte.descriptionAccromath: More advanced questions related to the various subjets presented in the Accromath's magazine.
Texte.descriptionDefault: This questions libray has been created by a person or a group not affiliated with the Math en Jeu's team.
Texte.explication: The advanced mode allows for the more experienced player to select his level among the various mathematical categories of the game. If desired, he can personnalize his gaming experience by choosing only the subjects he is interested in.
Texte.texteTables: Choose an open table in the room :
Texte.aucuneTable: There's no open table in this room
Texte.choixTable: or wait to be opened one
Texte.choixTemps: Choose the duration of the game you wish to play.
Texte.GUITemps: How long would you like to play (in minutes) :
Texte.choixNiveau: Don't wait for other players! Start the game!
Texte.GUIdejaConnecte: This user is already connected. Close this window and start again with another user!!!
Texte.GUIhorsService: The server does not answer. Check you connection and start again. If the problem persist, please click on the following link to perform a connection test and then send the result to the SMAC technical team. We are sincerely sorry that you are experimenting this problem.
Texte.GUIerreurQuestion: Math en jeu is unable to load the question. Please check your internet connection or communicate with the SMAC technical team. We are sincerely sorry that you are experimenting this problem.
Texte.GUIerreurRetroaction: Math en jeu is unable to load the retroaction. Please check your internet connection or communicate with the SMAC technical team. We are sincerely sorry that you are experimenting this problem.
Texte.GUIbanane: just threw a banana at you. For the next 90 seconds, the questions you'll be asked will be more difficult. Also, your allowed movements have been diminished by 2 steps.
Texte.GUIutiliserLivre: Do you really want to use the book?
Texte.salleTexte: • In the main menu choose Play button. • Choose a room to play in. For example, you can choose the Newton room. Click on the room’s name and then click on Continue. • If there is a table open and you want to play with these people, click on this table. Then click on Continue. Otherwise, click on “Create a new table” and choose how many minutes you want to play. • By clicking on the left or on the right-pointing arrow, choose you character. Click on Continue. • The level you choose will not affect the difficulty of your questions. It modifies the capacity of the virtual opponents to answer the quesions. Click on the level you want and then click on Continue.
Texte.elementsJeuTexte:
Basic rules:
• On the game board, you character appears bigger than the other player’s. • You character can move in four directions. To the front, to the back, to the left, and to the right the same line. The accessible cells appear in yellow. • Your character can move between one and six cells at once. The bigger the displacement, the harder the question, relative to the academic level on your registration. • The number of points a question is worth depends on the length of the displacement. A one cell displacement is worth three point, a two cells displacement is worth five points, and so on. • The cells with a question mark bring you to a game if the question is answered correctly. The points won in that game will be added to your score. • The winner is the player with the most points.
Texte.objetsTexte:
The objects you can buy or find are:
The banana •The banana allows you to play a wicked trick on another player!
The book •The book eliminates an answer choice for you on a multiple choice question. The number of choices then decreases from four to three.
The crystal ball •If you feel unable to answer a question, you may use the crystal ball. The computer will then give you a new question.
Texte.casesSpecialesTexte:
There are 3 special cells in the game:
The coins •The coins you pick up on your way allow you to buy objects (they cost one coin each).
The shops •It is here that you can spend your coins!
Cell ? •Something special happens when you step on this cell...
Texte.optionsTexte:
You can change different settings of the game:
Activate or deactivate sound effects...
Activate or deactivate music...
Move the screen in the direction of you choice to explore the board...
Zoom in or zoom out from the board...
